oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Design and optimization of sheet hydroforming process for manufacturing oil tank
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PRAKASH, C
NARASIMHAN, K
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The need for reduction of weight is an important issue in sheet metal forming industry. The hydroforming process has become an effective manufacturing process, as it can be adapted for the manufacturing of complex structural components with high structural stiffness. The process parameters and material properties are important factors that influence the quality of final product. In this paper, an optimized window of process parameters is obtained for successful sheet hydroforming of Oil tank. The simulation of hydroforming process is performed by using a Finite Element Method based Commercial code.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Numisheet 2005: Proceedings of the 6th International Conference and Workshop on Numerical Simulation of 3D Sheet Metal Forming Processes, Pts A and B,778,591-594
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 6th International Conference and Workshop on Numerical Simulation of 3D Sheet Metal Forming Processes,Detroit, MI,AUG 15-19, 2005
